Loan.Article: The loan calculator (bank loan calculator) is used for online calculation of the payment amount, overpayment, real interest rate or total loan cost, which should be disclosed by both SberBank and other commercial banks. You can also find out which part of the payments goes towards the repayment of the principal loan amount and which part goes towards the repayment of the loan interest. This loan calculator allows online calculation for two types of payments: annuity payment - this is an equal monthly loan payment, which includes the amount of accrued interest on the bank loan and the principal amount, used in most commercial banks; differentiated payment - this is a monthly payment that decreases towards the end of the loan term, consisting of a constant part of the principal and interest on the outstanding loan balance, often used by SberBank. The loan calculator is used to compare different types of loans and obtain the necessary information without the help of bank specialists.

Loan Rate.Article:
The interest rate is the most important criterion that should be evaluated before taking a loan. The unit of measurement for the loan rate is the annual percentage rate. It shows the amount of interest accrued on the debt for one year. In fact, the annual rate is divided into 365 days and accrued daily. Each bank has its own principles for issuing loans, as well as interest rates.
Factors influencing the formation of the loan rate: 
Central Bank of Russia key rate. The bank lends you not its own money, but the money it borrowed from the central bank at the key rate. To make a profit, the bank adds additional percentages to the key rate. The lower the key rate, the more advantageous it is to take a loan, as the overpayment will be less. Central Bank meetings are regularly held, during which the key rate is adjusted. It can increase or decrease depending on the economic situation in the country on the world stage.
Loan type. The less the bank is confident in the reliability of the loan, the more you will have to overpay for it. For example, mortgage rates are much lower than consumer loan rates because in this case, the bank has the purchased property as collateral. In other cases, the bank has few guarantees that the borrower will consistently repay the loan, so the interest rate is higher.
Borrower characteristics. First of all, this includes the credit history and quality of your interactions with a specific bank. Bank employees will certainly evaluate the borrower's credit history to make a decision on both the fact of issuing a loan and the interest rate. The better the history, the lower the interest rates. Payroll clients of the bank have the opportunity to receive a discount of 0.3 to 0.6 percent.
